title: Game of Thrones Pilou Asbaek pitches alternative ending to George RR Martin
text:
What do you make of this alternative ending to Game of Thrones? (Picture: HBO)

Game of Thrones star Pilou Asbæk has called on Game of Thrones creator George RR Martin to write an alternative ending for his barbaric villain Euron Greyjoy in the Song of Ice and Fire series, of which the TV adaptation is based.

Euron perished at the hands of Jaime Lannister (played by Nikolaj Coster-Waldau), who returned to King’s Landing for one last kiss from his lover, sister and mother of his unborn child Cersei Lannister (Lena Headey), before he was stopped in his tracks for a scrap with the biggest monster in Westeros.

Jaime managed to escape from Euron, but not before his rival delivered the fatal blow which sealed the Kingslayer’s fate, regardless of King’s Landing later crashing down and crushing his entire family.

The finale was divisive, to say the least, but Pilou has proposed a different outcome for his maniac as George is still working on finishing the next title in his literary series.

While receiving an Esquire Spain trophy at the annual Men of The Year Awards, the Danish actor released a video, sharing an open letter to Lena and Nikolaj.

To Lena, he wrote: ‘I’m in Madrid to receive another award for that delicious romantic comedy we starred in. Lovely memories. I’ve texted George R.R. Martin suggesting him to change that Golden Company s**t for those golden rings.

Pilou Asbaek has ideas for George RR Martins next book Picture: Xinhua/REX/Shutterstock)

George, you listening? (Picture: Rex Features)

‘The books should end with our wedding, saying yes over two marvelous elephants, ideally. George seems not to be online. Would you mind phoning him? And what about tweeting that I was and will always be the love of your life?

‘I miss you. Yours, Pilou. Please do it for your salty boy, blondie.’

His words to Nikolaj, however, were a little less sentimental:

‘You need to clarify in public [that] I was the one who killed you, not the f**king brick. Please, seriously, come on. Confirm it on Twitter, or in your next interview, I don’t give a s**t.

Pilou made a plea to make sure we all know who really killed Jaime Lannister (Picture: HBO)

‘Oh, by the way, I received the golden hand replica, and you were right: what a feeling! It feels so good, why were you complaining so much on set? It’s great to have a golden hand! Besides that, I’m pretty cool man. Right now I’m in Spain, the most beautiful place in the world.

‘All the best, yours, Pilou.

‘P.S. Please remember to tell people that I killed you, not the f**king brick.’

Will Pilou get his wish? Only time can tell, but Bran Stark star Isaac Hempstead-Wright, whose hero floored everyone to become ruler of the now Six Kingdoms, recently admitted he’d be ‘gutted’ if the books to follow the same path as the HBO series.

Game of Thrones seasons one to eight are available to stream on NOW TV.
